alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Lorain; Medina; Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 11:03AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...An intense lake effect snow band will affect southwestern Cuyahoga...northeastern Medina...western Summit and northern Lorain Counties Until noon EST.... At 1103 AM EST, radar indicated an intense lake effect snow band along a line extending from near Lorain to Strongsville to near Cuyahoga Falls, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARDS INCLUDE... Visibility rapidly dropping to less than a quarter of a mile... Up to 2 inches of quick snow accumulation... Locations impacted include... Akron, Lorain, Elyria, Medina, Parma, Cuyahoga Falls, Strongsville, Brunswick, Westlake, North Royalton, North Ridgeville, Barberton, Avon Lake, Amherst, Grafton, North Olmsted, Avon, Broadview Heights, Brook Park and Berea. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this snow band passes your location. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/cle and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. && ODOT DMS 301, 305, 316, 603, 613, 614, and 604.
